0.user_question: A football team has 168628 members.  There are twice as many players on the offense as there is on the defense. There is half the number of players on the special teams as there is on the defense.  How many players are on the defense?

direct_answer.text: Let D represent the number of defensive players. Thus O represents Offensive Players (D*2) & S Special Teams players (D/2). Let’s write out our equation according to these variables; we know all three add up equaling Total Members which equals  168628:      O+D+S=T     or   2D+(D)+(D/2)=T         Solving this yields:          D=( T / (2.5 )        As such, plugging back into my formula above allows us solve for Defensive Player Numbers       OR                             D= 168628/( 2.5 ), thus                D= 67451 players representing those playing defence. Hence, I can conclude if you need any further clarifications don’t hesitate contact me!

From condition 2, since there are twice as many people on the offense (\(O\)) as on the defense (\(D\)), it follows that \(O = 2D\). Finally, according to condition 1, considering the entirety of the sportsmen comprise both the offense and defense plus the special teams totals summing up to 168,628 members, i.e., \(168,628 = D + O + S \Rightarrow 168,628 = D + 2D + \frac{D}{2} \). subanswer.text: Solving this equation results in \(x=\frac{168628*2}{7}\), therefore the size of the defensive squad would equal approximately 48,752 players. The answer is 48752.

direct_answer.text: To solve for 'x', we need to find out what represents one variable among three – Defence ('D'), Offence('o')and Special Teams ('St'). According to statement B, o = D × 2 which can also be written as ‘Offence’ equals double times the value represented by “Defence". Meanwhile according to Statement C it was mentioned St = O / 2 which means ‘Special Team Players’ equals Half time played by the Offence.
